entry.title: Ukraine's Zelensky Calls for More Military Aid Ahead of Battles in Eastern Regions
entry.content: The Ukrainian president launched a fresh appeal for help as his country prepares to step up the fight for its eastern regions, while France sent a police unit from its armed forces to Ukraine to investigate potential war crimes.

entry.title: Moscow's Central Banker Dismantles What She Built
entry.content: Elvira Nabiullina, who strove to integrate Russia into the world economy, has dropped that mission for a new one—shielding the populace from the fallout of sanctions over the Ukraine invasion. “She’s clearly been second fiddle in Putin’s orchestra.”

entry.title: France's Le Pen Plays Down Far-Right Agenda to Broaden Appeal
entry.content: The National Rally party leader’s new approach, coupled with a significant rightward shift in French politics, helped Marine LePen win 22.9% of the estimated vote in the first round of France’s presidential election. President Emmanuel Macron received 28.2%.
